titleStmt.title: Variants of the stressed definite article
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the stressed definite article, add an example!.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Attested only twice in a male, 73 year old speaker from the Nʕēm tribe and who had lived in ʕAmmīq (Bekaa Valley until he was 14.

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)

"There is no evidence in the data of prefixes (definite article, particles, shortened demonstratives, etc.), being considered as integral parts of the word for the purposes of stress." (Pickett 2005:229)
the article is stressable as an integral part of the word. (Blanc 1970:143)
Note that the vocative morpheme yaa and the definite article al- count as part of the word for stress purposes.(Owens 1984: 210)
In the text there are a few cases where the stress falls on the article. (Palva 1976:23)
In very few instances, these forms coexist with others, e.g. álǧimal and ilǧámal or álmiy and ilṃayyih.
Only exists in stock lexemes such as álbil or álmiy ("the water"), which must be loans from neighboring bedouin dialects.
In very few instances, these forms coexist with others, e.g. álǧimal and ilǧámal or álmiy and ilṃayyih.
Only exists in stock lexemes such as álbil or álmiy ("the water"), which must be loans from neighboring bedouin dialects.
"The only dialect in Sinai with a stressable article, but which doesn not allow stress on initial vowels in the perfect verbal of measures n-1 and 1-t.
